Class OneTimePad

  • java.lang.Object
    • OneTimePad
  • public class OneTimePad
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple encrypter that shifts a message by any number through a predefined alphabet in the enctyper. This handles gathering input from the user and printing the encrypted message to the screen.
    Author:
    Wil Simpson

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts the program

      • askRunAgain

        private boolean askRunAgain()
        Keeps asking the user if the program should run again until a valid response is given.
        Returns:
        whether the user chose to run the program again

      • askValidString

        private java.lang.String askValidString​(java.lang.String message,
                                        java.lang.String[]... validStrings)
        Keeps sending the user a given string and asks for their input until one of the valid strings is given. If there are no valid strings then any string entered is valid. The string is not case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        message - message to display to the user that tells the user what to input
        validStrings - valid inputs. not case sensitive
        Returns:
        valid string given in console

      • containsString

        private boolean containsString​(java.lang.String message,
                               java.lang.String[] strings)
        Checks if a message contains any string in a given array
        Parameters:
        message - message to check
        strings - string to check for
        Returns:
        whether the message contains any of the strings

      • askValidInt

        private int askValidInt​(java.lang.String message,
                        int[]... validInts)
        Keeps sending the user a given message and asking for an int from the console with a given message until a valid one is given. If there are no required valid ints then any int entered is returned.
        Parameters:
        message - message to display to the user that tells the user what to input
        validInts - valid ints. no valid ints means any int is acceptable
        Returns:
        int given in console
